page.title: 04Religion in Scaleby
page.content: The vicar, Rev. Ronald Leatherbarrow is rector of{Kirklinton} and { {Hethersgill}as well as Scaleby. There is one sercice at Scaleby on Sundays. Once a month there is a Family Secice when 50 to 100 people come, but on other weeks there are 20 to 25. The church has no choir, but the Vicar is trying to get young people to join in the services. Sunday School meets in the Parish Hall next to the church after the service. There is also a Young Mothers Group which meets on Fridays and a Bible Study each Wednesday evening. On Friday evenings there is a Children's Club. In the last year there have been five weddings and 25 baptisms in the last eighteen months. There is also a Methodist Chapel at Scaleby Hill, just outside the area.
